intro: Acilepis squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa acilepis, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, woolly appearance, with dense, white, cottony hairs covering its stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Acilepis squarrosa is considered a vulnerable species.
